SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox

Class MailboxNameCodec

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.MailboxNameCodec
public final class MailboxNameCodec extends Object
Encodes and decodes mailbox names for safe filesystem storage.

This codec uses a modified Quoted-Printable encoding based on RFC 2047, but adapted for filesystem safety. The encoding uses =XX hex format (where XX are uppercase hex digits) for:

  • All non-ASCII characters (UTF-8 bytes with value > 127)
  • Path separator characters (/, \)
  • Windows-forbidden characters (: * ? " &lt; &gt; |)
  • The escape character itself (=)
  • Control characters (0x00-0x1F)
  • Null byte (0x00)

Unlike full RFC 2047, this codec does not use the =?charset?Q?...?= wrapper format, as the ? character is forbidden in Windows filenames. The encoding is always UTF-8.

Filesystem Compatibility:

  • Unix/Linux: All characters except / and null are valid. This encoding handles both.
  • Windows: Forbidden characters \ / : * ? " &lt; &gt; | are all encoded. Reserved names (CON, PRN, etc.) are not specifically handled as they are rare in mailbox names.
  • macOS: Similar to Unix; : is also encoded for HFS+ compatibility.

The encoded output contains only: A-Z a-z 0-9 . _ - =

Example: 

 "Données/été" → "Donn=C3=A9es=2F=C3=A9t=C3=A9"
 "Reports:2025" → "Reports=3A2025"
Author:
Chris Burdess
